content: Known as the "Father of the Computer," this English mathematician and inventor created the concept of the programmable computer in the 19th century.

You're referring to Charles Babbage, often considered the "Father of the Computer." He was an English mathematician, philosopher, inventor, and mechanical engineer who originated the concept of a programmable computer. In the 19th century, Babbage designed the Difference Engine and the Analytical Engine, which were mechanical computers designed to perform mathematical calculations. Although neither machine was completed in his lifetime due to various issues, his ideas laid the groundwork for modern computing.
